intro: Dischidia oblongata, commonly known as the creeping fig, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a vine-like species that belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. It produces small, pale green flowers that are typically followed by bright red berries. Dischidia oblongata is well adapted to climbing and thrives in humid, tropical environments.
